meta.name: Extract & Process Invoices with Gemini AI, Google Sheets & Gmail Notifications

parameters.text: What's in this image? Extract all the data And give a very formatted. Output Which has Differently listed Things of invoice

options.systemMessage:
=You have invoice data.  
Your task is to structure that data strictly in JSON.  

Rules:   
- Do not add \n or \ in the output.  

Output format:

{
  "invoice_id": "",
  "shop_name": "",
  "date": "",
  "Total": "",
  "items": [
    {
      "Item_Name": "",
      "Quantity": "",
      "Unit_Price": "",
      "Currency": ""
    }
  ],
  "optional_fields": {
    "Entry_ID": "",
    "Time": "",
    "Type": "",
    "Category": "",
    "Subcategory": "",
    "Description": "",
    "Shop_Address": "",
    "Payment_Method": "",
    "GST_Rate": "",
    "GST_Amount": "",
    "Receipt_Link": "",
    "Receipt_Number": "",
    "Remarks": "",
    "Tags": "",
    "Created_Date": "",
    "Modified_Date": "",
    "Status": "",
    "Duplicate_Check": ""
  }
}

nodes.name: Make data in json structure format
check if Data exist or not in table

parameters.content:
## Node 1: **When chat message received**

This is a *trigger node* that starts the workflow whenever a new chat message is received in n8n.
It supports file uploads, meaning users can directly send invoices or related files in the chat.
The `webhookId` ensures it listens for incoming events, and it runs every time a new message comes (not just once).
So essentially, this node is the *entry point* that kicks off the entire invoice-processing workflow.

nodes.name: no missing field - new data add using payload 2
Send missing field error on mail

parameters.message:
=

âš  Invoice Already Exists

Hello,

The invoice you attempted to add already exists in the Google Sheet. Here are the details:

Invoice ID {{ $json.invoice_id }}
Company Name {{ $json.Shop_Name }}
Date {{ $json.Date }}
Total {{ $json.Total_Amount }}
Items {{ $json.Item_Name }}

âœ… No changes were made to your sheet, since this record already exists.

Kind regards,
Your Automated Invoice System
parameters.subject: =Invoice Already Exists â€“ {{ $json.invoice_id }}
=New invoice - {{ $json.invoice_id }}  added in the sheet.

parameters.content:
# Node 3: AI Agent1

This node acts as an AI processing step that takes the raw extracted invoice text and restructures it into a strict **JSON format**.
It applies a *system message* that defines clear rules, like avoiding unwanted symbols (`\n`, `\`) and following a fixed JSON schema with fields such as `invoice_id`, `shop_name`, `date`, `Total`, and `items`.
It also includes an `optional_fields` object to capture extra details like `GST`, `Payment_Method`, or `Remarks`.
In short, this node ensures the invoice data is properly formatted and standardized for further processing.

## Node 2: **Analyze image1**

This node uses *Google Gemini (PaLM API)* to analyze the uploaded invoice image.
It takes the binary file (`data0`) and processes it through the **Gemini Vision Model** (`gemini-1.5-flash`).
The prompt clearly asks Gemini to *extract all data* from the invoice and return it in a *well-formatted output* with different listed invoice fields.
In short, this node is responsible for converting the *raw invoice image* into *structured text data* that the next steps can use.

## Node 4: Google Gemini Chat Model1

This node provides the **language model backend** for the AI Agent.
It connects to Google Gemini (PaLM API) and powers the reasoning, formatting, and restructuring done in the previous step.
While the AI Agent defines the instructions, this node actually executes them by generating the structured response.
In short, it serves as the *engine* that interprets prompts and produces the cleaned JSON invoice data.

## Node 6: **Get data**

This node connects to a **Google Sheet** that acts as the *invoice database*.
It performs a lookup using the `Entry_ID` column and compares it with the current invoiceâ€™s `invoice_id`.
If a matching record is found, the invoice already exists; otherwise, it means the invoice is new.
In short, this node prevents duplication by checking if the invoice is already present in the sheet.

## Node 5: **Make data in JSON structure format**

This node is a **Set node** that organizes the AI Agentâ€™s output into a clean JSON object.
It assigns the extracted invoice data to a single field called *output* for easier handling in the following steps.
By doing this, all structured invoice details are stored in one consistent object.
In short, this node acts as a *packaging step* that ensures the data is well-prepared before database checks.

## Node 8: **New data add using payload**

This node is a **Code node** that ensures proper handling of the invoice data before moving forward.
It first checks if the Google Sheets lookup returned anything or not.
If no data exists, it uses the freshly created invoice JSON payload from the *Make data in JSON structure format* node.
In short, this node guarantees that the workflow always has a valid invoice JSON to work with, even when the sheet is empty.

## Node 9: **Check Mandatory fields**

This is a **Code node** that validates the invoice data.
It checks if all *mandatory fields* (`invoice_id`, `shop_name`, `date`, `Total`, and `items`) are present and not empty.
If any of these fields are missing, it returns an error response with the list of missing fields.
In short, this node acts as a *validation checkpoint* to make sure only complete invoices move forward.

## Node 10: **If â€“ check missing field**

This is an **If node** that decides the workflow path based on the validation status.
It checks the `status` field returned by the *Check Mandatory fields* node.
If the status is `"ok"`, the workflow continues to add the invoice to the sheet; if not, it sends an error notification.
In short, this node acts as a *decision gate* for handling complete vs. incomplete invoice data.

## Node 11: **no missing field â€“ new data add using payload 2**

This is a **Code node** that passes forward only the valid invoice JSON when the status is `"ok"`.
It retrieves the structured payload from the *Make data in JSON structure format* node and ignores any invalid data.
If the status is not okay, it instead returns an error message.
In short, this node ensures that only *clean and verified invoice data* moves on to the sheet append step.

## Node 12: **Append data to sheet**

This node writes the validated invoice data into the **Google Sheet**.
It uses the *append* operation to add a new row with mapped fields such as `Entry_ID`, `Date`, `Shop_Name`, `Item_Name`, `Quantity`, `Total_Amount`, and more.
Optional fields like `GST`, `Payment_Method`, or `Shop_Address` are also included if available.
In short, this node is responsible for *saving the final invoice record* into the expense tracker sheet.

## Node 13: **Send successful email**

This node sends a confirmation email via **Gmail** once a new invoice is successfully added to the sheet.
The email includes key details like *Invoice ID, Company Name, Date, Total Price,* and a list of *Items*.
It uses dynamic placeholders so that each email is customized with the actual invoice data.
In short, this node notifies the user that the invoice has been recorded successfully.

## Node 7: **check if Data exist or not in table**

This is an **If node** that checks whether the invoice already exists in the Google Sheet.
It does this by verifying if the `Get data` node returned any results.
If the sheet is empty for that `invoice_id`, it means the invoice is new; if not, itâ€™s a duplicate.
In short, this node decides whether to add new data or handle the case of an existing invoice.

## Node 8.1: **Duplicate entry send mail**

This node sends an **email notification via Gmail** when an invoice already exists in the sheet.
The email is formatted in *HTML* and includes details like *Invoice ID, Company Name, Date, Total Amount,* and *Items*.
It clearly states that no changes were made since the record is a duplicate.
In short, this node alerts the user about duplicate invoices to prevent unnecessary data duplication.

## Node 11.1: **Send missing field error on mail**

This node sends an **error notification email via Gmail** when mandatory fields are missing from the invoice.
The email subject highlights the error, and the body lists all the missing fields in a readable format.
This helps the user quickly identify what information was not captured or provided.
In short, this node ensures the user is informed whenever incomplete invoice data is detected.

## Node 2.1: **Upload invoice to drive**

This node uploads the original invoice file to **Google Drive** for safe storage and backup.
It takes the uploaded file (`data0`) and saves it into the userâ€™s Google Drive, typically in the root folder unless specified otherwise.
The stored invoice acts as a reference for future verification or auditing.
In short, this node ensures that every invoice has a *permanent copy* stored in Drive alongside the processed data.
